name: BLR021: Cara Neir - Portals to a Better, Dead World LP
description:
Texas duo Cara Neir return with "Portals to a Better, Dead World", their first full length to appear on vinyl. Fans of the band won't be disappointed as it's Cara Neir at their best. "Portals..." is full of instantly catchy songs and ferocious riffs. 

"The fact that a band can bring together so many different sounds and still sound cohesive is a laudable feat." - The Inarguable

500 12" copies of "Portals..." are available. 100 on smoke green and 400 on black vinyl. Included are an insert, download code and full color jacket (each hand numbered) with artwork by Nate Burns of Vit. Insert art created by Lucy Boyakhandjyan.

Only 48 of the green smoke vinyl are available from our end.

Co-released with Halo of Flies Records.

The LP can be ordered with the Ramlord Split cassette.

Released 31, October 2013

Stream - http://brokenlimbsrecordings.bandcamp.com/album/portals-to-a-better-dead-world

name: BLR001: Vattnet Viskar - S/T CDr (First press edition)
description:
First pressing of Vattnet Viskar's debut EP. Later repressed by Burning World Records.

Recently unearthed first pressing CDr version of it's S/T EP. Limited copies remain.

"Vattnet Viskar are from New Hampshire, and they play black metal. The cold and wooded areas of the tip of the United States can provide just as much of a dark and atmospheric inspiration to musicians as the frozen fjords and vast forests of Norway. Their self-titled EP was recorded in a barn during the chilly New England fall. The band has stated that the lyrics explore mankindâ€™s relationship to his environment, and how small we are in comparison to the vastness of nature. But this EP is anything but small sounding..." - Cvlt Nation
